Define Documentation

#define HS_CR_CHILD_TASK_ERR_EID   101

'Error Creating Child Task for CPU Utilization Monitoring,RC=0x%08X'

Event Message:
'Error Creating Child Task for CPU Utilization Monitoring,RC=0x%08X'
Type: ERROR
Cause:
This event message is issued when CFS Health and Safety is unable to create its child task via the CFE_ES_CreateChildTask API

The RC field contains the return status from the CFE_ES_CreateChildTask call that generated the error

'Error Registering Sync Callback for CPU Utilization Monitoring,RC=0x%08X'

Event Message:
'Error Registering Sync Callback for CPU Utilization Monitoring,RC=0x%08X'
Type: ERROR
Cause:
This event message is issued when CFS Health and Safety is unable to create its sync callback via the CFE_TIME_RegisterSynchCallback API

The RC field contains the return status from the CFE_TIME_RegisterSynchCallback call that generated the error.

#define HS_REPORT_DIAG_CC   12

Name:
Report Util Diagnostics
Description
Reports the Utilization Diagnostics
Command Mnemonic(s):
Command Structure
HS_NoArgsCmd_t
Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
  • $sc_$cpu_HS_CMDPC - command counter will increment
  • The HS_UTIL_DIAG_REPORT_EID informational event message will be generated when the command is executed
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
  • Command packet length not as expected
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
  • $sc_$cpu_HS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Criticality
None

'Utilization Diagnostics Mask has been set to %08X'

Event Message:
'Utilization Diagnostics Mask has been set to %08X'
Type: Debug
Cause:
This event message is issued when CFS Health and Safety successfully processes the HS_SET_UTIL_DIAG_CC command.

The Mask parameter contains the new mask value.

#define HS_SET_UTIL_PARAMS_CC   13

Name:
Set Utilization Calibration Parameters
Description
Sets the Utilization Calibration Parameter
Command Mnemonic(s):
Command Structure
HS_SetUtilParamsCmd_t
Command Verification
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
  • $sc_$cpu_HS_CMDPC - command counter will increment
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
  • Command packet length not as expected
  • Any parameter is set to 0.
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
  • $sc_$cpu_HS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
Criticality
None

#define HS_SET_UTIL_PARAMS_DBG_EID   104

'Utilization Parms set: Mult1: %d Div: %d Mult2: %d'

Event Message:
'Utilization Parms set: Mult1: %d Div: %d Mult2: %d'
Type: Debug
Cause:
This event message is issued when CFS Health and Safety successfully processes the HS_SET_UTIL_PARAMS_CC command.

The Mult1, Div, and Mult2 fields contain the updated utilization parameters.

Definition at line 214 of file hs_custom.c.

Referenced by HS_SetUtilParamsCmd().

#define HS_SET_UTIL_PARAMS_ERR_EID   105

'Utilization Parms Error: No parameter may be 0: Mult1: %d Div: %d Mult2: %d'

Event Message:
'Utilization Parms Error: No parameter may be 0: Mult1: %d Div: %d Mult2: %d'
Type: Error
Cause:
This event message is issued when CFS Health and Safety fails to processes the HS_SET_UTIL_PARAMS_CC command. due to a 0 as at least one of the parameters.

The Mult1, Div, and Mult2 fields contain the utilization parameters from the command.

Definition at line 228 of file hs_custom.c.

Referenced by HS_SetUtilParamsCmd().

#define HS_UTIL_DIAG_REPORT_EID   103

'Mask 0x%08X Base Time Ticks per Idle Ticks (frequency): %i(%i), %i(%i), %i(%i), %i(%i)'

Event Message:
'Mask 0x%08X Base Time Ticks per Idle Ticks (frequency): %i(%i), %i(%i), %i(%i), %i(%i)'
Type: INFORMATION
Cause:
This event message is issued when CFS Health and Safety receives the HS_REPORT_DIAG_CC command.

The Mask field contains the current utilization diagnostics mask. The subsequent fields contain from lowest to fourth lowest, the time time ticks per idle ticks, and the number of times it occurred (in parentheses).

Definition at line 201 of file hs_custom.c.

Referenced by HS_UtilDiagReport().

void HS_IdleTask ( void   ) 

Task that increments counters.

Description
This child task is started by the HS initialization process. It runs at the lowest priority on the system, incrementing a counter when all other tasks are idle. This counter is used to determine CPU Hogging (by being non-zero each cycle) and Utilization.
Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
None

Definition at line 394 of file hs_custom.c.

References CFE_ES_IncrementTaskCounter(), CFE_ES_PerfLogEntry, CFE_ES_PerfLogExit, CFE_ES_RegisterChildTask(), CFE_PSP_GetTime(), CFE_SUCCESS, HS_CustomData, HS_IDLETASK_PERF_ID, HS_UtilizationIncrement(), HS_CustomData_t::IdleTaskRunStatus, OS_time_t::microsecs, HS_CustomData_t::ThisIdleTaskExec, HS_CustomData_t::UtilArray, HS_CustomData_t::UtilArrayIndex, HS_CustomData_t::UtilArrayMask, and HS_CustomData_t::UtilMask.

void HS_UtilizationIncrement ( void   ) 

Increment the CPU Utilization Tracker Counter.

Description
Utility function that increments the CPU Utilization tracking counter, called by Idle Task. This counter is used to determine both utilization and CPU Hogging.
Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
None
See also:
HS_UtilizationMark

Definition at line 522 of file hs_custom.c.

References HS_CustomData, and HS_CustomData_t::ThisIdleTaskExec.

Referenced by HS_IdleTask().

void HS_UtilizationMark ( void   ) 

Mark the CPU Utilization Tracker Counter.

Description
Utility function that marks the CPU Utilization tracking counter while saving the previous value to a variable for use in calculating CPU Utilization and hogging.
Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
None
See also:
HS_UtilizationIncrement
